meanings.definition: The world beneath the surface of the earth, especially the realm of the dead in Greek and Roman mythology.
meanings.sent1: In some stories, the underworld is depicted as a dark and mysterious place where spirits dwell.
meanings.sent2: Many ancient myths talk about heroes venturing into the underworld to rescue loved ones.
meanings.sent3: The ghost in the movie decided to throw a party in the underworld, inviting all the departed souls.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like an underworld, filled with buried memories waiting to resurface.
meanings.sent5: The underworld was described as a shadowy realm where echoes of the past lingered.

meanings.definition: A secret, criminal, or illegal world or society.
meanings.sent1: The police worked tirelessly to dismantle the criminal underworld operating in the city.
meanings.sent2: Some movies portray the underworld as a place where shady deals and illegal activities thrive.
meanings.sent3: The cat believed there was an underworld of mice plotting against her every move.
meanings.sent4: She discovered an underworld of deceit and betrayal lurking beneath the surface of her seemingly perfect life.
meanings.sent5: The underworld of hackers was a dangerous place where digital thieves roamed freely.
